column5: I was looking for a fishing report on Ear Falls area for the last week or so, really excited about going up and wondering where the fish are biting. Thanks!
Good contact is through Four Seasons Sport Shop in Ear Falls. Friendly helpful people. Michael is best to speak with.807 222 2200WWhttp://www.walleyewarrior.com
Good contact is through Four Seasons Sport Shop in Ear Falls. Friendly helpful people. Michael is best to speak with.807 222 2200WWhttp://www.walleyewarrior.com

I was just up there, got back from a 4 day trip. We caught a total of 5 walleyes between the 2 of us, we couldn't beg the walleyes to bite. caught a fair share of slimers though. Looks bad for Lac Suel hopefully it changes for you.

Don't know how you only caught only 5 walleye in 4 days; lake has been HOT all year. Was out 2 hrs and caught 30+ walleye just two days ago. Mike at 4 seasons is a putz - as far as is known he has never even been on the lake- just likes to sell tackle to you yanks. Don't let yourself down, the lake is doing extreemly well, talk to an outfitter or a local guide for the real scoup.

A word about 4 seasons. I don't know Mike, & I can't remember her name ,But there is a stricking looking lady that works there & she gave us very good advise. in late may on what to use, how & even where. I'll listen to her advice any time I'm up (&We've already booked next years trip!)
Tell me about your trip. What areas did you fish? What sort of presentations did you use? I've never heard of Lac Suel W's with that kind of lockjaw. Maybe we can offer you some tips. TGG

if its Pam you are thinking of Mike is her hubbyAs for a putz that someone else mentioned about Michael, talk to them and make your own mind up, Pam amd Mike are pretty good people.Most of the town depends on the tourist trade not just four seasons. WWhttp://www.walleyewarrior.com
bottom bouncers is all you need, 1 oz or 1 1/2 oz
